intro: Savia revoluta, commonly known as the revolute savia, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Savia revoluta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats.
